intro: Eriocarpum blephariphyllum, commonly known as the silky everlasting or silky everlasting daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers surrounded by pale green bracts. The plant has a mat-forming growth habit and produces tiny, silky, wind-dispersed seeds. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. Eriocarpum blephariphyllum is adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
